page.title: 02Grimethorpe- Environment
page.content: Grimethorpe{is for the most part {surrounded by woods and open fields. You can turn your back on the dirt and smoke of industry and see a completely different world.There are beautiful rolling hills and pleasant woods teeming with wildlife of all kinds. Many public footpaths enter Grimethorpe from all directions- trodden by the early miners.There is a{Nature Trail in Howell Wood}with a part-time warden.Many footpaths lead to the Common Land on Brierley-Great Houghton Commons.This common land was very much larger until the 39-45 war when it was put to the plough.It has not yet been returned to the people. The countryside provides a ready source of enviromental education for schools and well used leisure facilities for adults and children.
